comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: It's not a dog at all!  It's a cross between a kangaroo and a sheep and is better known as a "wooly jumper"!!!!  My vote says that of course it's a child - nobody would be so cruel as to put an outfit like that on a boy - would they????

comment.author: 10424498@N03
comment._content: I have been wrong before but I vote Boy- This is based on extensive research at your recent excellent expo at the Gallery in temple bar..

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Michael Cox of Tramore was 5 in the Census of 1901. His mother is allegedly named Piersess!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Amazing name, and the only example in Ireland according to the Census of 1901. She had disappeared by 1911. In fact, couldn't find a plausible James (husband), either. Michael, aged 15, may be at Clongowes (born in Cork). I think this might not be Michael above, but a son born after the Census of 1901. This photograph also in our Poole Collection looks to me like Piersess with the fur muff from the photo above and maybe Michael sitting beside her, and the child above in a pram...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
